back.text:
Root: س م و (S-M-W)
Meaning: In the name (of)
Pronunciation: Bismi
Tajweed Rules: Connect with next word when reading.
Derived Words:
1. اسْم (Ism): Name
2. سُمُوّ (Sumūw): Highness
Example Ayah: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ

Root: أ ل ه (A-L-H)
Meaning: Allah (God)
Pronunciation: Allāh
Tajweed Rules: Lām of Allah is heavy (tafkhīm) here because preceded by fatḥah.
Derived Words:
1. إِلَٰه (Ilāh): Deity/god
2. أُلُوهِيَّة (Ulūhiyyah): Divinity
Example Ayah: الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ

Root: ر ح م (R-Ḥ-M)
Meaning: The Most Merciful
Pronunciation: Ar-Raḥmān
Tajweed Rules: Shaddah on ر; heavy ghunnah on م.
Derived Words:
1. رَحْمَة (Raḥmah): Mercy
2. رَحِيم (Raḥīm): Merciful
Example Ayah: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ

Root: ر ح م (R-Ḥ-M)
Meaning: The Especially Merciful
Pronunciation: Ar-Raḥīm
Tajweed Rules: Similar to الرَّحْمَٰنِ; shaddah on ر.
Derived Words:
1. رَحْمَة (Raḥmah): Mercy
Example Ayah: الرَّحْمَٰنِ الرَّحِيمِ

Root: ح م د (Ḥ-M-D)
Meaning: All praise
Pronunciation: Al-Ḥamdu
Tajweed Rules: Clear ل; qalqalah on د when stopping.
Derived Words:
1. مَحْمُود (Maḥmūd): Praised
2. حَمِيد (Ḥamīd): Praiseworthy
Example Ayah: الْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

hint.text: All forms of true praise belong to Allah.

back.text:
Root: ر ب ب (R-B-B)
Meaning: Lord, Sustainer
Pronunciation: Rabb
Tajweed Rules: Shaddah on ب with ghunnah.
Derived Words:
1. تَرْبِيَة (Tarbiya): Nurturing
2. رُبُوبِيَّة (Rubūbiyyah): Lordship
Example Ayah: رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

hint.text: The One who nurtures and sustains.

back.text:
Root: ع ل م (ʿ-L-M)
Meaning: Worlds, all creation
Pronunciation: Al-ʿĀlamīn
Tajweed Rules: Madd at the end (2 counts) when stopping.
Derived Words:
1. عِلْم (ʿIlm): Knowledge
2. عَالِم (ʿĀlim): Knower, scholar
Example Ayah: رَبِّ الْعَالَمِينَ

Root: م ل ك (M-L-K)
Meaning: Owner, King
Pronunciation: Mālik
Tajweed Rules: Natural madd on مَا (2 counts).
Derived Words:
1. مَلِك (Malik): King
2. مِلْك (Milk): Ownership
Example Ayah: مَالِكِ يَوْمِ الدِّينِ

hint.text: Absolute Owner of the Day of Judgment.

back.text:
Root: ي و م (Y-W-M)
Meaning: Day
Pronunciation: Yawm
Derived Words:
1. أَيَّام (Ayyām): Days
Example Ayah: مَالِكِ يَوْمِ الدِّينِ

hint.text: Refers to the Day of Judgment.

back.text:
Root: د ي ن (D-Y-N)
Meaning: Judgment, recompense
Pronunciation: Ad-Dīn
Derived Words:
1. دِين (Dīn): Religion
2. مَدِين (Madīn): Indebted
Example Ayah: مَالِكِ يَوْمِ الدِّينِ

Root: ه د ي (H-D-Y)
Meaning: Guide us
Pronunciation: Ihdina
Derived Words:
1. هُدًى (Hudā): Guidance
2. هَادٍ (Hādī): Guide
Example Ayah: اهْدِنَا الصِّرَاطَ الْمُسْتَقِيمَ

hint.text: A plea for guidance to the straight path.

back.text:
Root: ص ر ط (Ṣ-R-Ṭ)
Meaning: Path
Pronunciation: As-Ṣirāṭ
Tajweed Rules: Ṣād is heavy (tafkhīm).
Derived Words:
1. صَرِيط (Ṣarīṭ): Road/path
Example Ayah: الصِّرَاطَ الْمُسْتَقِيمَ

Root: ق و م (Q-W-M)
Meaning: Straight, upright
Pronunciation: Al-Mustaqīm
Derived Words:
1. قَامَ (Qāma): To stand
2. اسْتِقَامَ (Istiqaama): To be upright
Example Ayah: الصِّرَاطَ الْمُسْتَقِيمَ
